Detailed Description

The error class. this is returned by most methods. It describes the an error if it occurred. Its usage is similar to the old C error mechanism errno. every functino returns one of these and it is the responsibility of the caller to check whether an error did in fact occur. this is done by calling isReal().

Version:
$Revision: 1.1.1.1 $
Author:
Michael Still , Blake Swadling <blake@swadling.org>

msg  a description of the cause of the error

cepError::~cepError (    ) 
 

Destructor. if this is called and the error has not been actioned then the error is logged. Note that if no error handler is installed, failure to action will not be detected

Member Function Documentation

void cepError::clear (    ) 
 

Clears the cepError by setting severity to sevOk and removing the current message

void cepError::display (    ) 
 

Displays the cepError via the currently installed error handler. If there is no error handler installed hen no action is taken

string& cepError::getMessage (    ) 
 

Queries the description of the current cepError

a description of the current cepError

Queries the severity of the current cepError

Returns:
the severity of the current cepError

bool cepError::isReal (    ) 
 

Check the status of the cepError

Returns:
false if the severity is sevOk, true otherwise.

void cepError::log (    ) 
 

Logs the cepError via the currently installed error handler. If there is no error handler installed hen no action is taken

void cepError::setErrorHandler (  class cepErrorHandler &    h )  [static]
 

Adds a global cepErrorHandler which will be used to display and log errors. If no error handler is installed then display and log are not performed

Parameters:
h  the error handler to be used by all cepErrors
